verses.verse: I will give her her vineyards from there, And (Josh. 7:26) the Valley of Achor as a door of hope; She shall sing there, As in (Jer. 2:1-3; Ezek. 16:8-14) the days of her youth, (Ex. 15:1) As in the day when she came up from the land of Egypt.
“And it shall be, in that day,” Says the LORD, “That you will call Me ‘My Husband,’ And no longer call Me ‘My Master,’
For (Ex. 23:13; Josh. 23:7; Ps. 16:4) I will take from her mouth the names of the Baals, And they shall be remembered by their name no more.

In that day I will make a (Job 5:23; Is. 11:6-9; Ezek. 34:25) covenant for them With the beasts of the field, With the birds of the air, And with the creeping things of the ground. Bow and sword of battle (Is. 2:4; Ezek. 39:1-10) I will shatter from the earth, To make them (Lev. 26:5; Is. 32:18; Jer. 23:6; Ezek. 34:25) lie down safely.
“I will betroth you to Me forever; Yes, I will betroth you to Me In righteousness and justice, In lovingkindness and mercy;
I will betroth you to Me in faithfulness, And ((Jer. 31:33, 34); Hos. 6:6; 13:4; (John 17:3)) you shall know the LORD.
“It shall come to pass in that day That (Is. 55:10; Zech. 8:12; (Mal. 3:10, 11)) I will answer,” says the LORD; “I will answer the heavens, And they shall answer the earth.
The earth shall answer With grain, With new wine, And with oil; They shall answer Jezreel.

Then (Jer. 31:27; Amos 9:15) I will sow her for Myself in the earth, (Hos. 1:6) And I will have mercy on her who had not obtained mercy; Then (Hos. 1:10; Zech. 13:9; Rom. 9:25, 26; (Eph. 2:11-22); 1 Pet. 2:10) I will say to those who were not My people, ‘You are My people!’ And they shall say, ‘You are my God!’ ”

(Israel Will Return to God) Then the LORD said to me, “Go again, love a woman who is loved by a (Jer. 3:20) lover and is committing adultery, just like the love of the LORD for the children of Israel, who look to other gods and love the raisin cakes of the pagans.”
So I bought her for myself for fifteen shekels of silver, and one and one-half homers of barley.
And I said to her, “You shall (Deut. 21:13) stay with me many days; you shall not play the harlot, nor shall you have a man—so, too, will I be toward you.”

For the children of Israel shall abide many days (Hos. 10:3) without king or prince, without sacrifice or sacred pillar, without (Ex. 28:4-12; 1 Sam. 23:9-12) ephod or (Gen. 31:19, 34; Judg. 17:5; 18:14, 17; (1 Sam. 15:23)) teraphim.

Afterward the children of Israel shall return and (Jer. 50:4) seek the LORD their God and (Jer. 30:9; Ezek. 34:24) David their king. They shall fear the LORD and His goodness in the ((Is. 2:2, 3); Jer. 31:9) latter days.

(God’s Charge Against Israel) Hear the word of the LORD, You children of Israel, For the LORD brings a (Is. 1:18; Hos. 12:2; Mic. 6:2) charge against the inhabitants of the land: “There is no truth or mercy Or (Jer. 4:22) knowledge of God in the land.
By swearing and lying, Killing and stealing and committing adultery, They break all restraint, With bloodshed upon bloodshed.

Therefore (Is. 24:4; 33:9; Jer. 4:28; 12:4; Amos 5:16; 8:8) the land will mourn; And (Zeph. 1:3) everyone who dwells there will waste away With the beasts of the field And the birds of the air; Even the fish of the sea will be taken away.
“Now let no man contend, or rebuke another; For your people are like those (Deut. 17:12) who contend with the priest.
Therefore you shall stumble (Jer. 15:8; Hos. 2:2, 5) in the day; The prophet also shall stumble with you in the night; And I will destroy your mother.
